Spider Packs. More terrifying than a lone sand spider is a group of sand spiders hunting together. They build connected lair networks called clusters, containing one female and two or three males. They work together with one sand spider attacking to draw attention, and the others attacking from trapdoors in the opposite direction, behind the skirmish line.

Sand Camouflage.name: Sand Camouflage
Sand Camouflage.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in sandy terrain.

Trapdoor Ambush.name: Trapdoor Ambush
Trapdoor Ambush.description:
When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is burrowed just below the surface of sand and a Medium or smaller creature enters the space on the surface just above where it is burrowed, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item Impaling Leg]] attack against the creature, bursting from the sand and revealing itself in the process.

The target has disadvantage on the saving throw to avoid being grappled.

utility.condition: when a creature walks over a sand spider’s hidden burrow

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item Bite]] attack and two [[/item Impaling Leg]] attacks.

Impaling Leg.name: Impaling Leg
Impaling Leg.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be &Reference[grappled apply=false]{grappled} (escape DC 16).

Until this grapple ends, the target is &Reference[restrained apply=false]{restrained} and takes [[/damage average activity=CprZiSqCQikhWwkc]] damage at the start of each of its turns, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t use the same Impaling Leg on another target.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has four Impaling Legs.

damage.condition: If grappled and restrained by the spider

affects.special: Grappled and restrained by the spider

Grappled & Restrained.name: Grappled & Restrained
Grappled & Restrained.description:
The target is &Reference[grappled apply=false]{grappled}.

Until this grapple ends, the target is &Reference[restrained apply=false]{restrained} and takes damage at the start of each of its turns.

Corrupting Ooze.name: Corrupting Ooze
Corrupting Ooze.description:
The ooze boils and bubbles with rank marsh gas and the fetid stench of the sewer. It leaves a stinking trail of acidic slime wherever it goes.

Swim and Walk. A corrupting ooze is a festering slime that can slither and even swim like a gigantic sea slug, or it can assume a roughly humanoid form and shamble through the streets. Its stench and its lack of speech, however, make it unlikely that anyone might mistake it for a person. They are frequently soldiers and servants to @UUID[Compendium.kp-tome-of-beasts-1-2023.tob-1-2023-creatures.Actor.tStmyqcxcwmvYSwD]{heralds of blood} (see page 232) and @UUID[Compendium.kp-tome-of-beasts-1-2023.tob-1-2023-creatures.Actor.8c5tpcI2FBo1wKgx]{heralds of darkness} (see page 233).

Dissolve Bones. A corrupting ooze can absorb an entire large animal or small person, simply dissolving everything in a matter of minutes. This function makes them an important element of certain dark rituals.

Strong Swimmer. A corrupting ooze naturally floats on the surface of water. It swims with a pulsating motion that propels it.

Putrid Stench.name: Putrid Stench
Putrid Stench.description: A creature that starts its turn within [[lookup @range.value activity=dnd5eactivity000]] feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or take [[/damage average]] damage and be &Reference[poisoned apply=false]{poisoned} until the start of its next turn.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target is &Reference[poisoned apply=false]{poisoned} until the start of its next turn.

Reshape Body.name: Reshape Body
Reshape Body.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can reshape its mass into a vaguely Humanoid shape or back into its amorphous shape.

It reverts to its amorphous shape if it dies.

While in a Humanoid shape, it can take any action that requires hands, except it can’t wield weapons or a shield or don armor.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item Slam]] attacks.

If both attacks hit one creature, the target must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or one nonmagical leather, metal, or wooden item the creature is wearing or carrying is destroyed.

This effect can’t destroy armor or weapons.

Naina.name: Naina
Naina.description:
This draconic creature is plumed and scaled in glittering, multicolored hues.

Dragons in Human Form. These minor dragons can take the shape of wise, old, human women. They retain full use of their sorcerous powers in their humanoid forms, and they can retain that form indefinitely.

Difficult to Spot. A naina shapeshifted into human form is nearly impossible to spot as anything but human unless she makes a mistake that gives away her true nature. This seldom happens. Draconic roars, a flash of scales, a fondness for raw meat, and a flash of wrathful dragon breath are the most common tells.

Hunted by Rumor. When rumors of a naina circulate, any woman who is a stranger may be persecuted, ostracized, or even tortured unless she can prove that she’s entirely human.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item Bite]] attack and two [[/item Claw]] attacks, or she makes three [[/item Slam]] attacks.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The naina transforms into a Medium Humanoid or back into her true form, which is a Dragon.

Her statistics, other than her size, are the same in each form.

Any equipment she is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed. It reverts to its true from if she dies.

Breath Weapons.name: Breath Weapons
Breath Weapons.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses one of the following breath weapons:

  • Poison Breath. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] exhales poison breath in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=HcLBC6Ri3FO1XhWG]]-foot [[lookup @target.template.type activity=HcLBC6Ri3FO1XhWG]]. Each creature in the area must make a [[/save format=long activity=HcLBC6Ri3FO1XhWG]]. On a failure, a creature takes [[/damage average activity=HcLBC6Ri3FO1XhWG]] damage and is &Reference[poisoned apply=false]{poisoned} for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn’t poisoned. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

  • Paralysis Breath. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] exhales paralyzing breath in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=hNebSSYc7GuoFLjM]]-foot [[lookup @target.template.type activity=hNebSSYc7GuoFLjM]]. Each creature in that area must succeed on a [[/save format=long activity=hNebSSYc7GuoFLjM]] or be &Reference[paralyzed apply=false]{paralyzed} for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

  • Sleep Breath. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] exhales sleep gas around it. Each creature within [[lookup @target.template.size activity=MLl4XoCtMY46Ea3W]] feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must succeed on a [[/save format=long activity=MLl4XoCtMY46Ea3W]] or fall &Reference[unconscious apply=false]{unconscious} for 10 minutes. This effect ends for a creature if the creature takes damage or another creature uses an action to wake it.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target is is &Reference[poisoned apply=false]{poisoned} for 1 minute.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: The target is paralyzed for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Paralysis Breath.name: Paralysis Breath
Paralysis Breath.description:
The naina exhales paralyzing breath in a 30-foot cone.

Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.JournalEntry.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.xnSV5hLJIMaTABXP]{paralyzed} for 1 minute.

The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Sleep Breath.name: Sleep Breath
Sleep Breath.description:
The naina exhales sleep gas around it.

Each creature within 20 feet of the naina must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or fall @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.JournalEntry.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.UWw13ISmMxDzmwbd]{unconscious} for 10 minutes.

This effect ends for a creature if the creature takes damage or another creature uses an action to wake it.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using [[lookup @attributes.spell.abilityLabel]] as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At will: [[/item .7fzjUq905Uqw6L4P]]{Charm Person}, [[/item .m2KeXAOirG8QMq1W]]{Dancing Lights} , [[/item .w8rIynsjKifWYeuP]]{Silent Image}

3/day each: [[/item .WnFnYEzr8r9XJXRw]]{Dispel Magic}, [[/item .TGnWSdUEO4OzeBuj]]{Hypnotic Pattern}, [[/item .GwpySroxyEx2fega]]{Invisibility}

1/day each: [[/item .pFtdenRsxIBOe3XO]]{Dimension Door}, [[/item .UgIDew5klLP1fxES]]{Dominate Person}

Poison Breath.name: Poison Breath
Poison Breath.description:
The naina exhales poison breath in a 60-foot cone.

Each creature in the area must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw.

On a failure, a creature takes 40 ([[/r 9d8]]) poison damage and is @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.JournalEntry.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.lq3TRI6ZlED8ABMx]{poisoned} for 1 minute.

On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn’t poisoned.

The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Sense Magic.name: Sense Magic
Sense Magic.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] senses magic within 120 feet of it at will. This trait otherwise works like the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8]{detect magic} spell but isn’t itself magical.

Charm Person.name: Charm Person
Charm Person.description:
You attempt to charm a humanoid you can see within range. It must make a Wisdom saving throw, and does so with advantage if you or your companions are fighting it. If it fails the saving throw, it is &Reference[charmed] by you until the spell ends or until you or your companions do anything harmful to it. The charmed creature regards you as a friendly acquaintance. When the spell ends, the creature knows it was charmed by you.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

Charm Person.name: Charm Person
Charm Person.description: The target is Charmed by the caster until the spell ends. The charmed creature regards the caster as a friendly acquaintance. When the spell ends, the creature knows it was charmed.

Dancing Lights.name: Dancing Lights
Dancing Lights.description:
You create up to four torch-sized lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover in the air for the duration. You can also combine the four lights into one glowing vaguely humanoid form of Medium size. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a new spot within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light winks out if it exceeds the spell's range.

materials.value: A bit of phosphorus or wychwood, or a glowworm

Silent Image.name: Silent Image
Silent Image.description:
You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 15-foot cube. The image appears at a spot within range and lasts for the duration. The image is purely visual; it isn't accompanied by sound, smell, or other sensory effects.

You can use your action to cause the image to move to any spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. For example, if you create an image of a creature and move it, you can alter the image so that it appears to be walking.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, because things can pass through it. A creature that uses its action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image.

materials.value: A bit of fleece

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any spell of 3rd level or lower on the target ends. For each spell of 4th level or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you automatically end the effects of a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used.

Hypnotic Pattern.name: Hypnotic Pattern
Hypnotic Pattern.description:
You create a twisting pattern of colors that weaves through the air inside a 30-foot cube within range. The pattern appears for a moment and vanishes. Each creature in the area who sees the pattern must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes &Reference[charmed] for the duration. While charmed by this spell, the creature is &Reference[incapacitated] and has a speed of 0.

The spell ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.

materials.value: A glowing stick of incense or a crystal vial filled with phosphorescent material.

Hypnotic Pattern.name: Hypnotic Pattern
Hypnotic Pattern.description: The creature is Charmed for the duration. While charmed by this spell, the creature is Incapacitated and has a speed of 0.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description:
A creature you touch becomes invisible until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is invisible as long as it is on the target's person. The spell ends for a target that attacks or casts a spell.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

materials.value: An eyelash encased in gum arabic

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description: The target becomes Invisible until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is invisible as long as it is on the target's person. The spell ends for a target that attacks or casts a spell.

Dimension Door.name: Dimension Door
Dimension Door.description:
You teleport yourself from your current location to any other spot within range. You arrive at exactly the spot desired. It can be a place you can see, one you can visualize, or one you can describe by stating distance and direction, such as "200 feet straight downward" or "upward to the northwest at a 45-degree angle, 300 feet."

You can bring along objects as long as their weight doesn't exceed what you can carry. You can also bring one willing creature of your size or smaller who is carrying gear up to its carrying capacity. The creature must be within 5 feet of you when you cast this spell.

If you would arrive in a place already occupied by an object or a creature, you and any creature traveling with you each take 4d6 force damage, and the spell fails to teleport you.

Dominate Person.name: Dominate Person
Dominate Person.description:
You attempt to beguile a humanoid that you can see within range. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be &Reference[charmed] by you for the duration. If you or creatures that are friendly to you are fighting it, it has advantage on the saving throw.

While the target is charmed, you have a telepathic link with it as long as the two of you are on the same plane of existence. You can use this telepathic link to issue commands to the creature while you are conscious (no action required), which it does its best to obey. You can specify a simple and general course of action, such as "Attack that creature," "Run over there," or "Fetch that object." If the creature completes the order and doesn't receive further direction from you, it defends and preserves itself to the best of its ability.

You can use your action to take total and precise control of the target. Until the end of your next turn, the creature takes only the actions you choose, and doesn't do anything that you don't allow it to do. During this time you can also cause the creature to use a reaction, but this requires you to use your own reaction as well.

Each time the target takes damage, it makes a new Wisdom saving throw against the spell. If the saving throw succeeds, the spell ends.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a 6th-level spell slot, the duration is concentration, up to 10 minutes. When you use a 7th-level spell slot, the duration is concentration, up to 1 hour. When you use a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the duration is concentration, up to 8 hours.

Dominate Person.name: Dominate Person
Dominate Person.description: The target is Charmed and must do its best to obey any commands sent by the caster.

Fetal Savant.name: Fetal Savant
Fetal Savant.description:
This creature resembles a blue-skinned dwarven infant, no older than a year. Its limbs flail, its head lolls with an obvious lack of coordination, and it screams incessantly.

Of the madness and insanity that resonates so strongly in derro society, perhaps none is as twisted as the derro fetal savant, born insane by the blessing of their eldritch masters and destined to lead their people further into madness.

Soul Swapping. Only the rarest of derro are born with the ability to exchange souls with other creatures, and the babbling infants are treated with maddened reverence. Oddly, this unique power causes an extreme sensitivity to bright light.

Carried into Battle. Placed in small, pillowed cages and borne aloft on hooked staves, the wild-eyed, magically gifted newborns are used to sow confusion among enemy ranks. Though typically carried into battle, fetal savants can make their cages float, freeing their carriers to better defend them when necessary.

Enchanted Cage.name: Enchanted Cage
Enchanted Cage.description:
The savant is immune to damage and can’t be the target of spells or effects as long as its cage exists.

The cage has a flying speed of 30 feet while the savant is inside of it, moving at the mental command of the savant.

When the cage is destroyed, the savant floats gently to the ground.

The cage has AC 19, 75 hp, and is immune to piercing, poison, and psychic damage.

A non-derro that touches the cage or hits it with a melee weapon attack while within 5 feet of it must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or take [[/damage average]] damage and be &Reference[frightened apply=false]{frightened} until the end of its next turn.

The cage disintegrates if exposed to sunlight for 1 hour.

Frightened.name: Frightened
Frightened.description: The target is &Reference[frightened apply=false]{frightened} until the end of its next turn.

Maddening Babble.name: Maddening Babble
Maddening Babble.description:
The savant constantly babbles eldritch nonsense while it can see any non-derro creatures and isn’t incapacitated.

Each non-derro creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the savant and can hear the babbling must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be &Reference[incapacitated apply=false]{incapacitated} until the start of its next turn.

Incapacitated.name: Incapacitated
Incapacitated.description: The target is &Reference[incapacitated apply=false]{incapacitated} until the start of its next turn.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The fetal savant makes two [[/item Psychic Burst]] attacks.

Soul Exchange.name: Soul Exchange
Soul Exchange.description:
The savant exchanges its soul with one Humanoid it can see within 20 feet of it.

Its body becomes &Reference[paralyzed apply=false]{paralyzed}, the target’s soul inhabits the savant’s paralyzed body, and the savant inhabits the target’s body, taking full control of it.

The savant retains its alignment, its Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, its Psychic Burst action, and its immunity to being charmed and frightened. It otherwise uses the target’s statistics, but doesn’t gain access to the target’s knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.

The exchange lasts until the target’s body or the savant’s body is reduced to 0 hp, the savant ends it as a bonus action, or the savant is forced out by an effect like the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.TkJ8Wtg1L7TZtspm]{dispel evil and good} spell.

When the exchange ends, the target returns to its body, regaining control, and the savant’s soul returns to its body, which is no longer paralyzed.

The target is immune to this savant’s Soul Exchange for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the exchange ends.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: The target is &Reference[paralyzed apply=false]{paralyzed}, the target’s soul inhabits the savant’s paralyzed body, and the savant inhabits the target’s body, taking full control of it.

Sunlight Hypersensitivity.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
Sunlight Hypersensitivity.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes [[/damage]] when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

Foundry Note

This feature includes an Active Effect in the Effects tab that applies disadvantage on ability checks. However, there is currently no automation to apply disadvantage to attack rolls at this time.

Sunlight Hypersensitivity.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
Sunlight Hypersensitivity.description: The target has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks while in sunlight.

Sandman.name: Sandman
Sandman.description:
Stick-thin and moon-faced with a raptor’s eyes and a mane of hawk feathers, this grinning humanoid pirouettes as nimbly as a dancer. Between its long, taloned fingers trickles sand that gleams with the cold light of stars.

Bringers of Nightmares. Sandmen are sinister-looking bringers of sleep and dreams. Visiting the mortal world each night, sandmen ensure that their targets slumber deeply and experience vivid dreams that swell the dream realm’s power. Some sandmen develop a talent for a specific flavor of dream; fantasies of lost love or childhood, prophecies and religious visions, or terrible nightmares.

Abduct Dreamers. Powerful dreamers attract both the attention and the protection of sandmen: children, madmen, would-be tyrants, and heroes. They protect such charges fiercely but have also been known to abduct them, taking them on wild adventures to inspire yet greater dreams. To them, all dreams are vital and good, be they uplifting or terrifying. Although they bring horrific nightmares as well as idyllic dreams, sandmen are not specifically baneful. Their actions are motivated by their connection to the dream realm, not by concerns over good and evil.

Ethereal Dreamscapes. When not on the Material Plane, sandmen ride bubble-like dreamscapes through the Ethereal Plane, breaching the Sea of Possibilities, nurturing and harvesting its contents. Sandmen are a common and welcome sight in markets across the Fey Realms, elemental planes, and even in Hell—anywhere that dreams or nightmares are a valuable commodity. They are merciless to any who threaten the sanctity of dreams, but especially @UUID[Compendium.kp-tome-of-beasts-1-2023.tob-1-2023-creatures-d.Actor.HddyZ00qQBm4HG2E]{dream eaters} (see page 148).

Stuff of Dreams.name: Stuff of Dreams
Stuff of Dreams.description: Made partially from dreams and imagination, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] isn’t fully real. Any critical hit against the sandman is a normal hit.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item Claw]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item Dreamer’s Sand]], if available.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

Damage from this attack doesn’t wake an unconscious creature, unless the unconscious creature is below half its hp maximum.

If the sandman scores a critical hit, the target is cursed with the eye-closer’s curse.

While cursed, the creature is &Reference[blinded apply=false]{blinded} until it finishes a long rest or until the curse is lifted by @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.XZhdgVK3cLoxNCQl]{remove curse} or similar magic.

Cursed.name: Cursed
Cursed.description: The target is cursed with the eye-closer’s curse. While cursed, the creature is &Reference[blinded apply=false]{blinded}.

Encourage Dreams.name: Encourage Dreams
Encourage Dreams.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] encourages powerful dreams in the minds of up to three unconscious creatures it can see within 30 feet of it.

Each target must make a DC 15 Charisma saving throw.

On a failure, nightmares fill the target’s mind, and the target takes [[/save format=long]] damage, wakes from its sleep, and is &Reference[frightened apply=false]{frightened} for 1 minute.

On a success, pleasant dreams fill the target’s mind, and the target regains [[/heal average]] and can choose to remain unconscious or awaken.

A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

save.condition: Targets must be unconscious

Frightened.name: Frightened
Frightened.description:
The target is &Reference[frightened apply=false]{frightened} for 1 minute.

A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Dreamer’s Sand.name: Dreamer’s Sand
Dreamer’s Sand.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] throws magical sand in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=dnd5eactivity000]]-foot [[lookup @target.template.type activity=dnd5eactivity000]].

Each creature in that area must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or fall &Reference[unconscious apply=false]{unconscious} for 10 minutes.

This effect ends for a creature if the creature takes damage or another creature uses an action to wake it.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Lorelei.name: Lorelei
Lorelei.description:
Lounging on a large river rock, this breathtaking fey calls plaintively to travelers.

Death to Men. A people born from an ancient oath to the River King, the loreleis’ cruelty stems from whatever happened to their people long ago that brought about their transformation into loreleis. Now, these callous river sirens compete with one another in manipulating and destroying male travelers, using their deadly kisses to great effect.

Beautiful Humanoids. Although legends describe the lorelei as golden-haired and fair-skinned, they come in all varieties, taking on the form of their most frequent prey. While most resemble sensual humans, a lorelei’s form can include elf, dwarf, and, in some recorded cases, even orc or hobgoblin.

Ignore Women. Women travelers are vexing for the lorelei. While the siren’s powers affect women as readily as men, the lorelei lacks the urge to destroy them. Women traveling alone or in all-female groups may pass through a lorelei’s territory safely, and they might even make peaceful contact.

Alluring Presence.name: Alluring Presence
Alluring Presence.description:
When a Humanoid that can see the [[lookup @name lowercase]] starts its turn within 30 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]], the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can force it to make a [[/save format=long]] if the [[lookup @name lowercase]] isn't incapacitated and can see the Humanoid.

On a failed save, the Humanoid is &Reference[charmed apply=false]{charmed} until the start if its next turn.

While charmed, the target is &Reference[incapacitated apply=false]{incapacitated} and must move on its turn toward the [[lookup @name lowercase]] by the most direct route, trying to get within 5 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] for a kiss from her.

The Humanoid doesn’t avoid &Reference[opportunity attacks], but before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage, the Humanoid can repeat the saving throw.

If the saving throw is successful, the effect ends for it, and it regains its senses for the remainder of its turn. Unless surprised, a Humanoid can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn.

If the Humanoid does so, it can’t see the [[lookup @name lowercase]] until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again.

If the Humanoid looks at the [[lookup @name lowercase]] in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

Charmed & Incapacitated.name: Charmed & Incapacitated
Charmed & Incapacitated.description:
The target is &Reference[charmed apply=false]{charmed} until the start if its next turn.

While charmed, the target is &Reference[incapacitated apply=false]{incapacitated}.

Free Water Spirit.name: Free Water Spirit
Free Water Spirit.description: While in contact with water, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] ignores &Reference[difficult terrain], and magical effects can’t reduce her speed or cause her to be restrained. In addition, she can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being grappled.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can use her [[/item Stunning Glance]]. She then makes three [[/item Psychic Blast]] attacks. She can replace one attack with a use of [[/item Corrupted Kiss]].

Corrupted Kiss.name: Corrupted Kiss
Corrupted Kiss.description: Melee Spell Attack: [[/attack]], reach [[lookup @item.range.reach]] ft. , one willing creature, or a creature that is incapacitated or restrained. [[/damage average extended]].

Stunning Glance.name: Stunning Glance
Stunning Glance.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] sends a seductive glance at a creature she can see within 30 feet of her.

The target must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be &Reference[stunned apply=false]{stunned} until the end of its next turn.

On a successful save, a creature is immune to this [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s Stunning Glance for the next 24 hours.

Stunned.name: Stunned
Stunned.description: The target is &Reference[stunned apply=false]{stunned} until the end of its next turn.

Amphibious.name: Amphibious
Amphibious.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can breathe air and water.

Qwyllion.name: Qwyllion
Qwyllion.description:
The reeking creature resembles a toothless, cadaverous hag. Its large eyes glow with unearthly green light, and ragged claws extend from its fingers.

Twisted Nymphs. Qwyllion (the name means “polluter” in Old Elvish) are fey who have been twisted by the corrupted magic of magical wastelands or warped by alchemical experiments into baleful versions of their former selves.

Frighten Animals. Besides making them hideously ugly, the transformation leaves them with a deadly gaze and the ability to control a living creature with a mere glance. Most animals can sense the corruption within the fey and refuse to approach it.

Goblin Mercenaries. Qwyllion are sometimes engaged by goblin sorcerers and evil mages to guard desecrated temples and despoiled gardens. The terms and payments for these arrangements vary wildly from one qwyllion to the next. Anyone who dares to employ a qwyllion must be constantly vigilant, because these creatures are prone to renege on any agreement eventually.

Nauseating Stench.name: Nauseating Stench
Nauseating Stench.description:
A creature that starts its turn within [[lookup @range.value activity=dnd5eactivity000]] feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be &Reference[poisoned apply=false]{poisoned} for 1 minute.

A poisoned creature that fails this saving throw is also &Reference[incapacitated apply=false]{incapacitated} while poisoned in this way.

A poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

If a creature’s saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s Nauseating Stench for the next 24 hours.

Poisoned & Incapacitated.name: Poisoned & Incapacitated
Poisoned & Incapacitated.description:
The target is &Reference[poisoned apply=false]{poisoned} for 1 minute.

A poisoned creature that fails this saving throw is also &Reference[incapacitated apply=false]{incapacitated} while poisoned in this way.

A poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item Claw]] or [[/item Deadly Gaze]] attacks.

If two Deadly Gaze attacks hit one creature, the target must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be &Reference[incapacitated apply=false]{incapacitated} until the end of its next turn.

save.condition: If hit twice by the attacking creature's Deadly Gaze attack

Incapacitated.name: Incapacitated
Incapacitated.description: The target is &Reference[incapacitated apply=false]{incapacitated} until the end of its next turn.

Deadly Gaze.name: Deadly Gaze
Deadly Gaze.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

A Humanoid slain by this attack rises 8 hours later as a specter under the qwyllion’s control, unless the Humanoid is restored to life.

The qwyllion can have no more than ten specters under its control at one time.

Specter Rises.name: Specter Rises
Specter Rises.condition: A Humanoid slain by this attack

Charm.name: Charm
Charm.description:
One Humanoid or Beast the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=dnd5eactivity000]] feet of it must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be magically &Reference[charmed apply=false]{charmed} for 1 day.

The charmed target obeys the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s verbal commands.

If the target suffers any harm or receives a suicidal command, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

If the target successfully saves against the effect, or if the effect on it ends, the target is immune to the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s Charm for the next 24 hours.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can have no more than one Humanoid and up to three Beasts charmed at a time.

If it charms another Humanoid or a fourth Beast, the oldest effect on a previous target ends.

Mngwa.name: Mngwa
Mngwa.description:
Tiny wisps of grayish smoke ooze from the slate-colored coat of this leonine creature.

Ethereal Lions. The elusive mngwa (MING-wah) are the offspring of a sentient feline beast from the Ethereal Plane that mated with a lioness long ago. Also called nunda (“smoke-cats”), mngwas are strong, cunning hunters who can elude pursuit or approach their prey unnoticed by disappearing briefly into the ether.

Rocky Terrain. Mngwas choose their hunting ground carefully, avoiding flatlands where competing predators are plentiful. They favor rocky and treacherous terrain where their talent for dancing along the veil between worlds allows them to outmaneuver their prey.

Feline Allies. The strongest mngwa recruit other great cats into their prides, though these associations tend to be short-lived. They hunt with especially savage groups of nkosi (see page 286), though only a great pridelord can command one during a hunt. When the hunt is over, the mngwa move on, and sometimes they take one of the young nkosi with them to become a shaman.

Ethereal Coat.name: Ethereal Coat
Ethereal Coat.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] AC includes its Charisma modifier (included above).

Ethereal Sight.name: Ethereal Sight
Ethereal Sight.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see 30 feet into the Ethereal Plane when on the Material Plane and vice versa.

Feline Passivism.name: Feline Passivism
Feline Passivism.description: No felines or weretigers can willingly attack the mngwa. They can be forced to do so through magical means.

Running Leap.name: Running Leap
Running Leap.description: With a 10-foot running start, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can long jump up to 25 feet.

Speak with Felines.name: Speak with Felines
Speak with Felines.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can communicate with felines as if they shared a language.

Ethereal Step.name: Ethereal Step
Ethereal Step.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] magically shifts from the Material Plane to the Ethereal Plane, or vice versa.

When it leaves or enters the Material Plane, a puff of gray smoke briefly appears in the space on the Material Plane it leaves or enters.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item Ethereal Bite]] attack and two [[/item Claw]] attacks.

Keen Smell.name: Keen Smell
Keen Smell.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

Pack Tactics.name: Pack Tactics
Pack Tactics.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

Shadhavar.name: Shadhavar
Shadhavar.description:
The gray unicorn appears desiccated with its skeleton clearly visible beneath its taut flesh. A haunting melody surrounds it.

Shadow Horses. Shadhavar are natives of the Plane of Shadow. Although they resemble undead unicorns, they are living creatures imbued with shadow essences.

Fey and Undead Riders. While the shadhavar are intelligent creatures, they sometimes serve as mounts for the @UUID[Compendium.kp-tome-of-beasts-1-2023.tob-1-2023-creatures.Actor.ynjE8JBDuOndx1Vt]{shadow fey} (see page 158), @UUID[Compendium.kp-tome-of-beasts-1-2023.tob-1-2023-creatures.Actor.qD6RMPxEcVnrWXdu]{noctiny} (see page 287), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.6qnT52lZtZblgGw8]{hobgoblins}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.rbyp54px2D0ql4QK]{wights}, or other creatures. They expect to be treated well during such an arrangement; more than one unkind rider has ridden off on a shadhavar and never returned.

Deceptive Hunters. Shadhavar use their hollow horn to play captivating sounds for defense or to draw in prey. They hunt when they must and are not discriminating about their quarry, but shadhavar primarily eat carrion. Despite their horrific appearance, they are not naturally evil.

Shadesight.name: Shadesight
Shadesight.description: Magical darkness doesn’t impede the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s darkvision.

Plaintive Melody.name: Plaintive Melody
Plaintive Melody.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] plays a captivating melody through its hollow horn.

Each creature within [[lookup @target.template.size activity=dnd5eactivity000]] feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] that can hear it must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be &Reference[charmed apply=false]{charmed} until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

While charmed, a creature is &Reference[incapacitated apply=false]{incapacitated}, its speed is reduced to 0, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on attack rolls against it.

Plaintive Melody.name: Plaintive Melody
Plaintive Melody.description:
The target is &Reference[charmed apply=false]{charmed} until the start of the shadhavar's next turn.

While charmed, the target is &Reference[incapacitated apply=false]{incapacitated}, its speed is reduced to 0.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item Gore]] attack and one [[/item Hooves]] attack.

Darkness Aura.name: Darkness Aura
Darkness Aura.description:
A [[lookup @target.template.size activity=dnd5eactivity000]]-foot [[lookup @target.template.type activity=dnd5eactivity000]] of magical darkness extends out from the [[lookup @name lowercase]], moves with it, and spreads around corners.

The darkness lasts as long as the [[lookup @name lowercase]] maintains concentration, up to 10 minutes (as if concentrating on a spell).

Darkvision can’t penetrate this darkness, and no natural light can illuminate it. If any of the darkness overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell creating the light is dispelled.

Berstuc.name: Berstuc
Berstuc.description:
Although slightly stooped, this male figure is muscular and broad-shouldered. The creature’s head is lost in a riot of moss, while a thick mustache and beard reach almost to its waist.

The hulking, moss-haired berstuc looks sculpted out of a primordial forest—it stands over 12 feet tall and weighs 800 pounds. Despite its great stature, it seems strangely gentle, with a serene, almost soothing presence. Nothing could be further from the truth; the berstuc is a murderous demon that stalks woodlands and jungles of the Material Plane.

Poisoned Fruit. Berstuc prowl forests in search of travelers to torment. A berstuc demon poses as a benevolent, or at least indifferent, wood spirit to gain the trust of mortals. It allows itself to be persuaded to help lost travelers (reluctantly) or to lead them to their destinations. Once it draws its unwitting prey deep into the woods, it strikes.

False Presence.name: False Presence
False Presence.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] detects as a Fey when sensed by spells and features, such as the detect evil and good spell or a paladin’s Divine Sense.

However, it is still a Fiend and can be subjected to spells and features that affect Fiends, such as Divine Smite.

Beasts and Plants find the berstuc’s presence soothing and don’t attack the [[lookup @name lowercase]] unless ordered to or provoked.

Forest Camouflage.name: Forest Camouflage
Forest Camouflage.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in forest terrain.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Twisted Path.name: Twisted Path
Twisted Path.description:
While in a nonmagical forest, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] leaves no trail and can’t be tracked, except by magical means.

Creatures of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s choice within 30 feet of it that travel with it can’t retrace their own trails, and become hopelessly lost after 1 hour of travel with the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Creatures led astray by the [[lookup @name lowercase]] have disadvantage on ability checks to discern their location or to navigate for 24 hours.

Verdant Nature.name: Verdant Nature
Verdant Nature.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] doesn’t require food or sleep.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The berstuc makes three [[/item Slam]] attacks. If two Slam attacks hit a Medium or smaller creature, the berstuc can use [[/item Enclose]] on it.

Slam.name: Slam
Slam.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target is &Reference[grappled apply=false]{grappled} (escape DC 17) if it is a Large or smaller creature and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] doesn’t have two other creatures grappled.

Grappled.name: Grappled
Grappled.description: The target is &Reference[grappled apply=false]{grappled} (escape DC 17) if it is a Large or smaller creature.

Enclose.name: Enclose
Enclose.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] encloses a Medium or smaller creature grappled by it in a mossy growth on the berstuc’s body, and the grapple ends.

While enclosed in the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s growth, the target is &Reference[blinded apply=false]{blinded} and &Reference[restrained apply=false]{restrained}, it has &Reference[total cover] from attacks and other effects outside the [[lookup @name lowercase]], and it takes [[/damage average]] damage at the start of each of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s turns. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can have only one creature enclosed at a time.

If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside its growth, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] at the end of that turn or expel the enclosed creature as the growth bursts.

The expelled creature falls @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.y0TkcdyoZlOTmAFT]{prone} in a space within 5 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, an enclosed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the growth by using 5 feet of movement, exiting prone.

Blinded & Restrained.name: Blinded & Restrained
Blinded & Restrained.description: The target is &Reference[blinded apply=false]{blinded} and &Reference[restrained apply=false]{restrained}, it has &Reference[total cover] from attacks and other effects outside the attacking creature.

Ravenala.name: Ravenala
Ravenala.description:
The tree steps forward on bark-covered legs. Its head is crowned by long-stemmed, green-paddled fronds and spiked seed pods, and its dangling arms end in hooked, wooden talons.

Leafy Advisors. Wise and long-lived like treants, ravenalas tend their coastal forest homes far from most societies. Tribal humanoids respect and venerate ravenalas and sometimes seek their advice or aid in times of great need. Ravenalas seldom interact with others unless approached.

Prisoner’s Lamentation. Unlike treants, ravenalas avoid physical conflict in favor of diplomacy and compromise. If annoyed, they imprison hostile creatures within their trunks rather than killing or eating the attackers. Trapped creatures must sing their own lament as they are carried off to a distant locale away from the ravenala’s home.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Woodland Stride.name: Woodland Stride
Woodland Stride.description: &Reference[Difficult terrain] composed of magical or nonmagical plants doesn’t cost the [[lookup @name lowercase]] extra movement. In addition, it can pass through magical or nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or a similar hazard.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item Bursting Pod]] or [[/item Slam]] attacks.

If both Slam attacks hit a Medium or smaller creature, the target is &Reference[grappled apply=false]{grappled} (escape DC 14), and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses its [[/item Lamenting Engulfment]] on the target.

Grappled.name: Grappled
Grappled.condition: If both Slam attacks hit a Medium or smaller creature

Grappled.name: Grappled
Grappled.description: The target is &Reference[grappled apply=false]{grappled} until they use an action to escape.

Bursting Pod.name: Bursting Pod
Bursting Pod.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]., and each creature within 5 feet of the target, including the target, must make a [[/save format=long activity=dnd5eactivity100]], taking [[/damage average activity=dnd5eactivity100]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Lamenting Engulfment.name: Lamenting Engulfment
Lamenting Engulfment.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] engulfs a Medium or smaller creature grappled by it.

The engulfed target is &Reference[blinded apply=false]{blinded} and &Reference[restrained apply=false]{restrained}, it has &Reference[total cover] against attacks and other effects outside the [[lookup @name lowercase]], and it must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] at the start of each of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s turns or sing a lament of the mistakes and misdeeds it has performed in its lifetime.

While singing, the engulfed creature can still act, but it can’t otherwise speak, including casting spells with verbal components.

If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves, the engulfed creature moves with it. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can have only one creature engulfed at a time.

Engulfed.name: Engulfed
Engulfed.description: The engulfed target is &Reference[blinded apply=false]{blinded} and &Reference[restrained apply=false]{restrained}, it has &Reference[total cover] against attacks and other effects outside the ravenala.

Healing Leaves.name: Healing Leaves
Healing Leaves.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] removes a leaf from its head and wraps the leaf around the wounds of one creature it can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=dnd5eactivity000]] feet of it.

The target magically regains [[/heal]]{3d6 hp} and is freed from any disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

Encourage Growth.name: Encourage Growth
Encourage Growth.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] whispers magical words of growth to nonmagical plants on a point it can see within 30 feet of it.

The plants burst with life and spread rapidly. The area within 20 feet of that point becomes &Reference[difficult terrain] for 24 hours.

Tosculi Drone.name: Tosculi Drone
Tosculi Drone.description:
This humanoid wasp’s gossamer wings beat out a soft, droning buzz. Flashing blades sing in each of her four clawed hands, and the air around her shimmers with magical dust. Dozens more humanoid wasps in a variety of iridescent colors surround her, weapons raised protectively.

The tosculi are waspfolk that share the Golden Song of the hive, which unites them under the command of their queen. Each hive has its own song, and most tosculi hives are predatory, dangerous places.

Drones. Tosculi drones are the workers of the tosculi hive: the smallest, weakest, least intelligent, and most abundant of the waspfolk. Their carapaces are mostly iridescent blue with gold abdomens and lower legs, and they have vestigial wings, allowing them to glide but not truly fly. Drones function primarily as menial workers but, during times of war, they also act as highly expendable scouts and soldiers. Because the warriors know whatever a drone knows—thanks to the queen—a drone doesn’t need to survive its scouting mission to deliver useful information.

Crowd Tactics.name: Crowd Tactics
Crowd Tactics.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can share its space with up to one other tosculi. While sharing its space with one other tosculi, it has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if the other tosculi in its space isn’t incapacitated.

Glide.name: Glide
Glide.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can extend its vestigial wings while falling to slow its rate of descent to 60 feet per round, landing on its feet and taking no falling damage.

It can move up to 5 feet horizontally for every 1 foot it falls.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t gain height with its wings alone.

If subjected to a strong wind or lift of any kind, it can use the updraft to glide farther.

Hive Sense.name: Hive Sense
Hive Sense.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can pinpoint the location of its hive queen when she is within 300 feet of it, and it can sense the general direction and distance to the hive where its queen makes her home.

Anubian.name: Anubian
Anubian.description:
Swirling sand comes together to form a snarling, canine-faced humanoid whose eyes shine with an eerie, blue glow.

Anubians are elementals summoned to guard tombs or protect treasures.

Piles of Dust. An anubian at rest resembles a pile of sand or dust, often strewn about an already dusty location. When active, it rises up to form a muscular humanoid with the head of a jackal. A destroyed anubian collapses into an inert pile of sand.

Death to the Unarmored. In combat, anubians prefer to fight unarmored foes rather than creatures wearing armor. They associate unarmored creatures with spellcasters, and their latent resentment over centuries of being summoned as servants drives them to attack such figures when they aren’t shackled by magical bondage.

Sandstorm Tag Teams. Anubians fight effectively as teams, using their haboob attacks to corner and isolate the most vulnerable targets.

Elemental Nature.name: Elemental Nature
Elemental Nature.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

Sand Camouflage.name: Sand Camouflage
Sand Camouflage.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in sandy terrain.

Sand Form.name: Sand Form
Sand Form.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can enter a hostile creature’s space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

Vulnerability to Water.name: Vulnerability to Water
Vulnerability to Water.description:
For every 5 feet the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 1d4 cold damage. An [[lookup @name lowercase]] completely immersed in water takes [[/damage average activity=aA3hIm3HExpj2vWD]] damage at the start of its turn.

Foundry Note

Scaling is configured in the Activity's setup for when the creature takes damage from moving through water or being splashed with water. The scale is set to 6, meaning that either the creature's movement is calculated as 5 multiplied by 6 (which equals 30), or it can handle up to 6 gallons of water splashed on it.

Sand Step.name: Sand Step
Sand Step.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] collapses into loose sand and teleports up to [[lookup @range.value activity=dnd5eactivity000]] feet to an unoccupied space it can see, reforming in that space.

If the destination space contains sand, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can immediately &Reference[Hide]

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t use [[/item Sand Step]] while [[/item Haboob]] is active.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item Claw]] attacks.

Haboob.name: Haboob
Haboob.description:
A 30-foot-tall cylinder of sand forms in the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s space and moves with it for 10 minutes, until the [[lookup @name lowercase]] ends the storm as a bonus action, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell).

The area within 5 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is heavily obscured.

A creature that starts its turn in that area or enters the area for the first time on a turn must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be &Reference[restrained apply=false]{restrained} by the storm.

While restrained, the creature takes [[/damage average]] damage at the start of each of its turns, and moves with the [[lookup @name lowercase]] when the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves.

A creature, including the restrained creature, can use its action to free the restrained creature by succeeding on a [[/check format=long]]

Restrained.name: Restrained
Restrained.description: The target is &Reference[restrained apply=false]{restrained} by the storm. The target can its action to free the restrained creature by succeeding on a DC 13 Strength check.

Hraesvelgr.name: Hraesvelgr
Hraesvelgr.description:
The giant stands braced in the midst of powerful wind. With a baleful stare, he shakes his fist and bellows a war cry. The cry becomes an avian shriek, and the giant’s form melts into that of a massive bird whose wings blot out the sky.

A giant with divine blood in his veins, Hraesvelgr the Corpse Swallower is powerfully muscled. His skin is a pale bronze, his eyes are violet, and his hair is the color of storm clouds.

Roc Form. When he takes his alternate form, Hraesvelgr becomes a tremendous roc, with massive wings that stir the wind across the sky. His eyes remain the same violet and these roc-form feathers match the color of his hair, sparkling with specks of color here and there, like jewels set in steel.

Birth of the Wind. Hraesvelgr dwells on the fringe of the world itself. From atop the peak of his home, he creates the wind and sends it across the globe. As befits a creature of such primal power, Hraesvelgr doesn’t take kindly to intruders. He gluts himself on the bodies of fools who test his might in search of the fabled riches in his home.

Hraesvelgr’s Lair

Hraesvelgr’s lair is a windswept crag of gray stone at the edge of the world. At the highest pinnacle rests a massive cottage hewn from the mountainside. A great nest made from the splintered trunks of immense trees rests on the flat roof of the cottage, and the wind constantly howls.

Lair Actions

On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Hraesvelgr takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; Hraesvelgr can’t use the same effect two rounds in a row:

  • Pillar of Wind. One creature within 60 feet that Hraesvelgr can see must succeed on a [[/save str 19 format=long]] or be swept up in a pillar of wind. The creature is &Reference[restrained]{restrained} and suspended 15 feet off the ground. A creature can take an action to free the restrained creature by succeeding on a [[/check str 19 format=long]]. If the restrained creature has a way to pull itself out of the air, it can free itself in the same way. If the restrained creature has a flying speed, it can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, this effect lasts until Hraesvelgr uses this lair action again or until he dies.

  • Powerful Exhale. Hraesvelgr unleashes a blast of wind in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in the area must succeed on a [[/save dex 19 format=long]] or be knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}.

  • Terrifying Utterance. Hraesvelgr lets out a thunderous bellow. Each creature within 30 feet of him and that can hear him must succeed on a [[/save con 19 format=long]] or be &Reference[frightened]{frightened} for 1 minute. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Regional Effects

The region containing Hraesvelgr’s lair is warped by his magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

  • Active Weather. Strong windstorms are common within 6 miles of the lair.

  • Roosting Rocs. Within 3 miles of the lair, giant avian Beasts are more populous and fiercely defend the area against intruders.

  • Stench of Decay. The wind within 10 miles of the lair bears a pungent carrion stench.

If Hraesvelgr dies, these effects fade over the course of [[/r 1d10]] days.

At the start of each minute, [[lookup @name]] can choose to change the precipitation and wind within 3 miles of him by one stage, up or down (no action required).

This effect works like the changing weather conditions aspect of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ZPd73HtKF3At11jh]{control weather} spell, except [[lookup @name]] can’t change the temperature and the conditions change immediately.

Alternatively, he can make three [[/item Gale Blast]] attacks.

If two Fist attacks hit one creature, the target must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be &Reference[stunned apply=false]{stunned} until the end of its next turn.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
[[lookup @name]] transforms into a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.p980augbCIdpK9ZX]{roc} or back into his true form, which is a Giant.

His statistics, other than his speed, are the same in each form. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed.

He reverts to his true form if he dies.

Foundry Note

An Active Effect (AE) is available to apply the movement adjustment while Hraesvelgr is in Roc form. Once Hraesvelgr transforms, use Apply Movement in Roc Form, then in the Chat Log select Roc Form Movement to apply it to the selected token.

Roc Form Movement.description: While in roc form, Hraesvelgr movement is 20 ft., fly 120 ft.

On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn’t pushed.

Titanoboa.name: Titanoboa
Titanoboa.description:
This titanic green serpent raises its enormous head high, its body extending in seemingly endless coils.

Territorial and Aggressive. Territorial and voracious, the rare titanoboa devours all trespassers in its domain. Stronger and faster than the giant anaconda, the true king of the rainforest is also more stubborn, fighting off entire groups of hunters and poachers. When stalking prey, these great serpents strike from ambush, swallowing even some dinosaurs in one bite.

Blinding Scales. Against groups of foes, titanoboas trust in their ability to dazzle their enemies with the light reflected from their scales, using this distraction to entwine the stunned foes in crushing coils.

Slow to Mate. Titanoboas mate rarely. They live for hundreds of years and never stop growing, which makes the need for propagation less urgent. When two titanoboas nest, the result is a brood of a half-dozen smaller snakes. An adult titanoboa is at least 80 feet long and weighs 6,000 pounds or more.

Slither.name: Slither
Slither.description:
If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] hasn’t eaten a Huge creature in the last 24 hours, it can easily move through any open large enough for a Large creature, and it can squeeze through any opening large enough for a Medium creature.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s destination must still have suitable room to accommodate its volume.

Sparkling Scales.name: Sparkling Scales
Sparkling Scales.description:
When a creature that can see the [[lookup @name lowercase]] starts its turn within 30 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is in bright light, isn’t incapacitated, and can see the creature, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can force the creature to make a [[/save format=long]].

On a failed save, the creature is &Reference[stunned apply=false]{stunned} until the start of its next turn.

Unless &Reference[surprise]{surprised}, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can’t see the [[lookup @name lowercase]] until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again.

If the creature looks at the [[lookup @name lowercase]] in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

Millitaur.name: Millitaur
Millitaur.description:
A purplish-black segmented worm the size of a horse, with hundreds of legs, black multifaceted eyes, and powerful mandibles wields a pair of stone axes.

Millitaurs roam jungles and woodlands, especially wherever dense undergrowth rots beneath the canopy and piles high. Leaves and plant matter provide much of the millitaur diet, but they also are good hunters and supplement with squirrel, monkey, gnome, and goblin.

Poisonous Drool. As formidable as they appear, millitaurs are the preferred prey of some dragons and jungle giants, and tosculi (see page 365) often hunt them for use as slaves and pack animals. In defense, they’ve developed a mild poison. Millitaur handaxes often drip with this substance, smeared on from the beast’s mandibles. They use their axes for breaking up mulch for easier digestion, as well as for hunting and self-defense.

Alchemists and Brewers. Millitaurs are capable alchemists and brew their own unique beverages, potions, and alchemical substances, using the various materials and substances provided by the plants and animals found in their jungle homes. When away from their burrows, millitaurs carry a handful of flasks for self defense, to ward off intruders, or to trade with respectful humanoids traveling near their territory.

Clicking Speech. Millitaurs communicate via body language, antennae movements, scent, and clicking sounds. Although they have no voice boxes, millitaurs can make sounds by artfully clicking and grinding their mandibles, and they mimic the sounds of Common in a peculiar popping tone. They can be good sources for local information so long as they are treated with respect and their territory is not encroached.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item Handaxe]] attacks.

Poisonous Flask.name: Poisonous Flask
Poisonous Flask.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] hastily combines alchemical substances into a poisonous concoction and throws it at a point the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=dnd5eactivity000]] feet.

Each creature within [[lookup @target.template.size activity=dnd5eactivity000]] feet of that point must make a [[/save format=long]].

On a failure, a creature takes [[/damage average]] damage and is &Reference[poisoned apply=false]{poisoned} for 1 minute.

On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn’t poisoned.

A poisoned creature can make a [[/save format=long activity=0gxSXJ9g5yuZdtz4]] at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description:
The target is is &Reference[poisoned apply=false]{poisoned} for 1 minute.

A poisoned creature can make another saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Healing Tonic.name: Healing Tonic
Healing Tonic.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] administers a healing tonic to a willing creature within 5 feet of it. The target magically regains [[/heal average]] and is freed from any disease or poison.

Night Scorpion.name: Night Scorpion
Night Scorpion.description:
These midnight-black scorpions have a bright-red stripe on their tails, signaling the crippling poison within.

Blinding Poison. This aptly named arachnid hunter blinds victims with a dose of its crippling poison. It feeds on whole camels when given the chance, but it more commonly devours goats, sheep, and people. It hunts by night, when its senses are most effective.

Underdark Giants. The species is common in deep caves and underworld realms. They are eight feet long with a seven-foot tail and daggerlike stinger. They weigh up to 200 pounds.

Valuable Venom. Night scorpion venom is highly prized and can command upwards of 400 gp per dose.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item Claw]] attacks and one [[/item Sting]] attack.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target is &Reference[grappled apply=false]{grappled} (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]).

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has two claws, each of which can grapple only one target.

Escape Check.name: Escape Check
Escape Check.condition: if grappled by the scorpion

Sting.name: Sting
Sting.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]., and the target must make a [[/save format=long]].

On a failure, the target takes [[/damage average activity=dnd5eactivity100]] damage and is &Reference[blinded apply=false]{blinded} for 1 hour.

On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn’t blinded.

If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also &Reference[poisoned apply=false]{poisoned} for 1 minute, and it is &Reference[paralyzed apply=false]{paralyzed} while poisoned in this way.

A poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Blinded.name: Blinded
Blinded.description: The target is &Reference[blinded apply=false]{blinded} for 1 hour.

Poisoned & Paralyzed.name: Poisoned & Paralyzed
Poisoned & Paralyzed.description:
If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also &Reference[poisoned apply=false]{poisoned} for 1 minute, and it is &Reference[paralyzed apply=false]{paralyzed} while poisoned in this way.

A poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Star Drake.name: Star Drake
Star Drake.description:
Twinkling motes of light move around the mottled, metallic scales of this dragon’s body. Light reflections twinkle like starlight across its metallic scales.

Returned Travelers. A drake’s curiosity sometimes drives it to seek experiences beyond its plane, and it finds companions with which it travels the multiverse. Such drakes return clearly changed in appearance, demeanor, and ability. Regardless of which type of drake embarked on the journey, the creature always returns as a star drake.

Mortal Protectors. Star drakes consider themselves protectors of the Material Plane. They view those from other planes as meddlers in the affairs of humanoid races, regarding fiends and celestials as equally threatening. Star drakes might negotiate with, drive off, or destroy such meddlers.

Unlikely Allies. Inexplicably, planewatchers (see page 293) can recognize when a drake that is exploring the planes is in the process of becoming a star drake, and they typically leave these drakes to their exploring. After a drake’s metamorphosis, planewatchers often aid the drake, seeing it as a sort of kindred spirit.

Nimbus of Swirling Stars.name: Nimbus of Swirling Stars
Nimbus of Swirling Stars.description: At the start of each of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s turns, each creature within [[lookup @target.template.size activity=0LyNK7GFNmQDKU2o]] feet of it and that can see it must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be &Reference[incapacitated apply=false]{incapacitated} until the end of its next turn.

Incapacitated.name: Incapacitated
Incapacitated.description: The target is &Reference[incapacitated apply=false]{incapacitated} until the end of its next turn.

Planar Weapons.name: Planar Weapons
Planar Weapons.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s weapon attacks are magical. When it hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 4d8 force damage (included in the attack).

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description:
The drake makes one [[/item Bite]] attack and two [[/item Claw]] attacks, or it makes four [[/item Searing Star]] attacks.

If two Searing Star attacks hit one creature, that creature must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be &Reference[blinded apply=false]{blinded} until the end of its next turn.

Blinded.name: Blinded
Blinded.description: The target is &Reference[blinded apply=false]{blinded} until the end of its next turn.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft. , one target. Hit: 16 ([[/r 2d10 + 5]]) piercing damage plus 18 ([[/r 4d8]]) force damage.

Planar Traveler.name: Planar Traveler
Planar Traveler.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can transport itself to a different plane of existence. This works like the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.J6Jpw5XzB5aTeqnz]{plane shift} spell, except the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can affect only itself and can’t use this action to banish an unwilling creature to another plane.

Plane-Altered Breath.name: Plane-Altered Breath
Plane-Altered Breath.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] exhales raw magic in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=dnd5eactivity000]]-foot [[lookup @target.template.type activity=dnd5eactivity000]].

Each creature in that area must make a [[/save format=long]], taking [[/damage average]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Rat King.name: Rat King
Rat King.description:
A great knot of scabrous rats scrabbles together as a mass, with skulls, bones, and flesh entangled in the whole. Teeth, eyes, and fur all flow as a single disturbing rat swarm walking on two legs.

Fused at the Tail. A rat king forms when dozens of rats twist their tails together in a thick knot of bone and lumpy cartilage—and offer praise to the rat demon Chittr’k’k (see Creature Codex). Its numbers and powers grow quickly.

Rule Sewers and Slums. The rat king is a cunning creature that stalks city sewers, boneyards, and slums. Some even command entire thieves’ guilds or hordes of beggars that give it obeisance. They grow larger and more powerful over time until discovered.

Plague and Dark Magic. The rat king is the result of plague infused with twisted magic, and a malignant ceremony that creates one is called “Enthroning the Rat King.” Rats afflicted with virulent leavings of dark magic rites or twisted experiments become bound to one another. As more rats add to the mass, the creature’s intelligence and force of will grow.

Keen Smell.name: Keen Smell
Keen Smell.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

Plague of Ill Omen.name: Plague of Ill Omen
Plague of Ill Omen.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] radiates a magical aura of misfortune.

A creature that starts its turn within [[lookup @range.value activity=dnd5eactivity000]] feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or have disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the start of its next turn.

Foundry Note

This feature includes Active Effects that provide disadvantage on ability saves. However, there is currently no automation to apply disadvantage to attack rolls.

Disadv. Attacks/Saves.name: Disadv. Attacks/Saves
Disadv. Attacks/Saves.description: The target has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the start of its next turn.

Absorption.name: Absorption
Absorption.description:
When a friendly rat, giant rat, or swarm of rats starts its turn within 5 feet of the rat king, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can absorb it.

If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] does so, the target dies, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] gains temporary hp equal to the target’s remaining hp.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item Bite]] attacks.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or suffer one level of &Reference[exhaustion apply=false]{exhaustion} and become infected with a &Reference[disease apply=false]{disease}.

Until the disease is cured, at the end of each long rest, the creature must repeat the saving throw.

On a failure, the creature suffers another level of exhaustion. The exhaustion lasts until the creature finishes a long rest after the disease is cured.

A creature that succeeds on two saving throws recovers from the disease.

Diseased & Exhaustion.name: Diseased & Exhaustion
Diseased & Exhaustion.description: The target suffers one level of &Reference[exhaustion apply=false]{exhaustion} and become infected with a &Reference[disease apply=false]{disease}.

Exhaustion (2nd Level).name: Exhaustion (2nd Level)
Exhaustion (2nd Level).description:
The target suffers another level of exhaustion. The exhaustion lasts until the creature finishes a long rest after the disease is cured.

A creature that succeeds on two saving throws recovers from the disease.

Call Rats.name: Call Rats
Call Rats.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] magically calls [[/r 2d4]] @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.pozQUPTnLZW8epox]{rats}, [[/r 1d4]] @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.q1YJIeIt6rK8fCKn]{giant rats}, or 1 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.8ihbbjkaOFTPbI73]{swarm of rats}.

The rats arrive in [[/r 1d4]] rounds, acting as allies of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and obeying its spoken commands.

The rats remain for 1 hour, until the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, or until the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dismisses them as a bonus action.

Dorreq.name: Dorreq
Dorreq.description:
These twitching balls of tentacles surround an inhuman face dominated by a squid-like beak.

Servants of the Void. The dorreq are servants to ancient horrors of the Void and realms beyond human understanding. They are guardians and sentries for such creatures, and they swarm and attack any creatures approaching too close to the elder aberrations they serve.

Death from Above. Dorreq prefer to drop on their victims from above, pinning them with their many tentacles and biting them with their large, chitinous beaks.

Dorreq of the Wasted West

Mages who study the Wasted West disagree whether the dorreq are something that slipped through with the Great Old Ones during the Mage Wars, or if they are creatures twisted and warped by the alien radiations of the Walkers. Regardless, they are most commonly found swarming on and around the enormous Walkers of the Wastes, tootling strange, alien harmonies through their beaks.

Void Warping.name: Void Warping
Void Warping.description:
The area around the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is warped by its connection to the Void.

A creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or its speed is halved until the start of its next turn.

Half Speed.name: Half Speed
Half Speed.description: The target's speed is halved until the start of its next turn.

Stone Step.name: Stone Step
Stone Step.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

The origin and destination spaces must contain a stone or rocky surface, such as a cliff face or rocky terrain.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The dorreq makes one [[/item Bite]] attack and two [[/item Tentacles]] attacks.

Tentacles.name: Tentacles
Tentacles.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is &Reference[grappled apply=false]{grappled} (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]) and pulled up to 5 feet closer to the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Until this grapple ends, the target is &Reference[restrained apply=false]{restrained}

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can grapple up to two creatures at a time.

Grappled & Restrained.name: Grappled & Restrained
Grappled & Restrained.description:
A Medium or smaller target is &Reference[grappled apply=false]{grappled} (escape DC 14) and pulled up to 5 feet closer to the attacking creature.

Until this grapple ends, the target is &Reference[restrained apply=false]{restrained}

Void Thrum.name: Void Thrum
Void Thrum.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] emits a barely audible, vibrating thrum laced with Void energy.

Each creature within 20 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must make a [[/save format=long]], taking [[/damage average]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Clockwork Huntsman.name: Clockwork Huntsman
Clockwork Huntsman.description:
The mechanical soldier is clad in flat-black armor, and beneath its breastplate, gears tick and whir.

Slave Hunters. These metal huntsmen were once the province of corrupt aristocrats, running down escaped slaves and tracking prey in hunting expeditions. Their masters may vary, but the clockwork huntsmen still perform when called upon.
